events.name: UXSG Conference 2016
events.description:
The biannual UXSG Conference returns this year with the theme "Transformation"!

No matter what product or service you work on; in an agency, corporation or startup; by yourself or with a team; the core of our craft remains the same – to transform the world, little by little, to become a better place. 

Join us as we explore the fundamental impact that design has on our everyday lives across: society, communities, products and services, and the self.

You'll learn from practitioners, directors, entrepreneurs (and a monk!) who have brought about change, not only in organisations but local groups and nations. Discover what you don’t know that you don’t know and plant the seed of your own transformation journey.

Check out the full programme, including 6 keynote presentations, 16 lightning talks, 1 Unconference and 12 workshops to choose from http://2016.uxsg.org/programme/.
events.location: Suntec Singapore Convention & Exhibition Centre, 1 Raffles Boulevard Suntec City 039593

events.name: Hottest AWS Related Services from Japan - Workshop!
events.description: Overview This daytime workshop will cover using a range of AWS related services provided by Japanese companies, in use by everyone from startups right up to Enterprises. This will also have an introduction and demo, to allow you to learn new technologies and features. Afterwards, please feel free to stick around for the AWS UG, which will be in the evening of the same day. Reasons to attend • Learn how you can use AWS more easy and effectively  • Learn Cloud Native usage of AWS  • Chance to get to know a Japanese tech company Who should attend • Anyone who interested in cloud services  • Business managers who would like to gain a greater understanding of cloud technology  • Developers, IT Managers or Business owners seeking to understand the basics of AWS  • Fans of AWS!! Agenda 1:00PM Admission starts 2:00PM - 5:00PM Cloud Automator (https://cloudautomator.com/en/) Cloud Automator is the best tool to automate Amazon Web Services (AWS) operations - such as EBS backup, start and stop EC2 instances. Use Case 1. Stop Development EC2 instances outside of work hours to save on cost. 2. Create EBS snapshot every week. 3. Create EC2 AMI every day 4. Snapshot RDS instance every Monday AMIMOTO(https://amimoto-ami.com/) in this opportunity, we share the fruit of our knowledge we've gotten in these ten years. The topics are below. 1. What's AWS and what's good about that? 2. What is the easiest way to use the world's most modern infrastructure for your (clients') websites? 3. What is the best practice to get most out of WordPress and AWS combination? Tools to solve the problem of advanced WordPress developers and business One of the largest problem that WordPress developers face when their business grow is hosting. Hosting is the core for stability, scalability, and speed. Also, the workflow must be modern. We need to get backups automatically, deploy changes repeatedly, update WordPress and plugins smoothly, while the websites must be working under any circumstances. Our work with clients have given us a lot of experience, and we have created the tools to solve problems and to make our daily jobs easier. All of them are open sourced! We introduce these tools on this event. The tools we show you are below. # 1. AMIMOTO simple instance AMIMOTO is an EC2 web server you can boost with one click. It's pre-configured to offer WordPress users to start serving their websites with the best set-up of the middleware and WordPress. Nginx, PHP7, and proxy caching server and all the useful tools such as WP-CLI, and plugins that combine AWS and WordPress. # 2. JIN-KEI Cloudformation JIN-KEI is a formation of the AWS services, such as EC2, RDS (the database), S3(the assets storage), CloudFront(the CDN), and Elastic Load Balancing. Setup this formation with one click and start serving all the traffic you get.   # 3. Other tools Based on AMIMOTO and JIN-KEI, there are more tools which you can utilize to boost your business. • Elasticommerce: A robust expansion kit for WooCommerce, which enables you to operate your site at minimal infrastructure cost, even with varying access numbers depending on the seasons, events, and promotional campaigns. • Elasticommerce Search Form: A cloud-based elastic product search. This offloads the heavy searching process from your WordPress and web server to AWS. • Elasticommerce Related Items: This will learn what customers have purchased and searched for. Based on this learning, it recommends items users would be most interested in. • Mautic: An open source software, which helps you automate your marketing process and communicate with users. • Plugins to offload things from your WordPress to AWS: Search, rankings, related posts, and things like these are better to be offered outside of WordPress, especially the sites are large and high-traffic. AWS are good at doing these calculations, so we should get the results back from the services through APIs. We have open sourced plugins to connect WP and outer services. 5:00PM - 5:30PM Question & Answer Session
events.location: AWS Offices Singapore, 23 Church Street, Capital Square, #10-01, Singapore - 049481, +65-67220300

events.name: The Perfumer’s Palette -Science of Scent
events.description:
The Royal Society of Chemistry in partnership with the Nose Who Knows is excited to present The Perfumer’s Palette course to enhance participants’ knowledge on the ingredients used in perfumery and hone their sense of smell

Topics covered will include:
How the sense of smell works; Memorization of an odor
The Perfumer’s Palette; Natural and Animalic raw materials; Synthetics raw materials
Extraction methods; Reproduction and Head Space®

Nose Who Knows is a fragrance studio dedicated to olfaction owned by Sandy Blandin, a former fragrance development manager at Swiss company Firmenich with over 15 years experience in fragrance creation and education
events.location: National University of Singapore, Science Drive 2, S16, Level 3, Active Learning Room (ALR), Singapore  117546

events.name: AWSUG-SG / JAWS Combined Meetup #1!
events.description: With the upcoming WordCamp Singapore event on 6th September, many people from JAWS-UG (Japan AWS User Group) will be travelling to Singapore in September. Subsequently, we've decided to run a joint event and help grow both sides of the community! While this meet-up will follow the standard format of "Talks and Chat", we're going to take more of an Lightning Talk style to give more variety.  Please get in touch either here or via private message if you have any submissions. AGENDA: • 1830->1900: Registration, snacks and drinks • 1900->1910: Opening Presentation  • 1910->1930: Singapore AWS UG Introduction • 1930->1950: JAWS-UG Introduction • 1950->2000: Refuel Break • 2000->2100: Lightning Talks: 6 Slots available, each around 5 minutes / 5 slides. Please submit ideas! • SMS Gateways as Microservices with AWS Lambda (Gayan Hewa) • Feedback Form with AWS SES, Lambda & API Gateway (Kai Hendry) • Infrastructure as code with terraform (Claudio Mettler) • 2100->2130: Networking • 2130 onwards: Afterparty (Location TBC) LOCATION: AWS Singapore office. https://goo.gl/maps/UzzR2 Issues finding us? Drop a note here or email alexjs at amazon dot com WHO CAN ATTEND: All are welcome! No prior experience needed. • Anyone who wants to know more about cloud computing and startup companies • Anyone who wants to understand the benefits of cloud computing and how to use the “cloud” to benefit their applications and organisation • Startup founders and aspiring founders
events.location: AWS Offices Singapore, 23 Church Street, Capital Square, #10-01, Singapore - 049481, +65-67220300

events.name: Security Wednesdays #12 "Counterfeit credit cards-one last run"
events.description:
Presentation Description:
Travel through time and learn about how credit card fraud at the point of sale have evolved over time. What exactly is a counterfeit credit card? How easy is it to make one? As card security increases over the next couple of years, fraud syndicates will have the opportunity to make one last run. We will wrap up the evening showcasing our real-time “packet inspecting" firewall for transaction appliance that is helping banks in the region combat Point of Sale fraud.

Speaker's Biography:
Sean is the CEO of Jewel Paymentech - a financial technology startup that develops intelligent tools to solve unique e-payments fraud risk issues.

He was formerly a Director of Fraud and Security Risk at Visa, responsible for the implementation of online multi factor authentication for credit/debit cards as well as the deployment of EMV chip ATMs in Southeast Asia.

With a background in systems and network security, Sean had previously served as the Global CERT Manager for Visa (VISA-CIRT), responsible for both incident management and forensics. Prior to joining Visa, he lead the hacking lab team at PricewaterhouseCoopers which conducted penetration testing and forensics.

-----
Stand a chance to win a free NUS Greyhats T-shirt at Security Wednesdays! Simply come down to find out out more about how you can get yours too!
events.location: NUS School of Computing COM1 02-04 Seminar Room 2, , Singapore

events.name: Singapore Clojure Meetup #9 Spec, SPAs with Clojurescript & AOB
events.description: After a long gap over the summer we are back with some cutting edge and some ClojureScript stuff. Spec - An Introduction (by Lucas Bradstreet) One of the gotchas with regards to Clojure and ClojureScript is the fact that they are dynamic languages and hence the absence of a type system. As most programmers come from more orthodox languages with large type systems this can cause problems. The authors of the language have recognised this and over the summer launched Spec which is a typical Clojurian take on type systems, infinitely customisable, extensible and brutally practical! Come and hear Lucas Bradstreet give an introduction to spec, how to start with it, ways to use it and not. It promises to be interesting.  Lucas Bradstreet who is a core developer on Onyx www.onyxplatform.org, an open source distributed batch and streaming platform built in, and for, Clojure. He works at Distributed Masonry, the stewards of the Onyx. Implement SPA with ClojureScript, Reagent/re-frame (by Hao Liu) This is an introduction to ClojureScript and a tutorial to implement a SPA (typerooni) with Reagent/re-frame, basic workflow to do the development.  Hao Liu is a Java veteran, but now with his full enthusiasm to FP, he has 2 years as a Colourist and is enthusiastic about the language. Discussion about the future of the group The long gap over the summer has highlighted several issues we as a group need to address. This is where we will do it. We are being hosted by our friends at Pivotal Labs yet again, with many thanks! Food (likely pizza) and soft drinks will be provided.

events.name: Open Space @ Sandcraw­ler (Software Craftsmanship)
events.description:
Open Space Facilitator: Steven & Marcelon Open Space Theme: Software Craftsmanship AOB: Drivers may park their cars at Galaxis or Fusionopolis. Sandcrawler does not provide parking for visitors.  Agenda 7:00pm - Networking and food 7:30pm - Topic generation 8:00pm - Breakout sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) 


What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology. 


Venue and food sponsor

events.name: Property based testing with ScalaCheck
events.description: Have you ever wanted to get better test coverage with fewer tests? Do you worry that your unit tests miss crucial edge cases? Have you ever found a deep bug and wondered how you could have ever thought of the unit test that would have caught that before it went into production? In this talk Hunar and Russell will explain how to use ScalaCheck to build tests that use randomly generated data to verify the behavior of your system.  This can discover loads of elusive bugs that are easily missed by conventional example based unit testing.   Looking forward to seeing you all there.
events.location: ThoughtWorks office, 87B Amoy Street, Level 3, Singapore

events.name: Hackware v2.2: Vintage Computing Special
events.description: "If you have any old piece of hardware include game consoles, just bring it down and give a talk. It does not matter if the hardware is not fully functional, bring it and talk about its history is fine. Can contact any of the admins to request a speaking slot. It is best if you have video converters to convert the video signal to minimum VGA or best HDMI to facilitate recording by Engineers.SG." Please also fill in this form for the venue security purpose. Please bring your photo ID:  https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfV7OKN1NZJsMZzIwGRZXijr3SqNv0ZTTxN5sVKXlQY8eJpwA/viewform We are moving to first Wednesday of every month from September to avoid organising meetups during most popular weeks of the month. Data:  http://data.webuild.sg/dataset/events-per-week-of-month/ (5min) Back to basics: Laws of physics and electronics - Sayanee Basu(15min) Floppy Disks - Lau Bernice(20min) Windows 3.1 on vintage and modern hardware - Yeo Kheng Meng(20min) Underwater ROV - Remotely Operated Vehicle - Hakim Hamid(10min) Demo of open source FPGA tool chain - Michał J. Gajda(5min) Slide rule - Yeo Kheng Meng(5min) Energy harvesting and its impact - Darshan Virupaksha
events.location: pin One Marina Boulevard, , Microsoft Singapore,Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989
